alert.note: Alert for Culberson; Jeff Davis; Loving; Reeves; Ward; Winkler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 4:58PM CST until February 26 at 6:30PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Northern Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Ward County in western Texas... Winkler County in western Texas... Northeastern Culberson County in southwestern Texas... Loving County in western Texas... * Until 630 PM CST. * At 456 PM CST, a dust channel was 7 miles southeast of Barstow, or 10 miles east of Pecos, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 182 and 211. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 86. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Monahans, Kermit, Wink, Toyah, Mentone, Thorntonville, Barstow, Pyote, Orla, Saragosa, Wickett, Toyah Lake, Pecos Municipal Airport, Slash Ranch, Roy Hurd Memorial Airport, Monahans Sandhills State Park, Verhalen, Winkler County Airport and B F Goodrich Testing Track. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Culberson; Jeff Davis; Loving; Reeves; Ward; Winkler
